sentences: Hän vaikka nauraa, mutta hän ei ole tosissaan.
Vaikka olisimme väsyneitä, meidän pitäisi silti jatkaa.
context: In Finnish, 'vaikka' is a conjunction used to introduce concessive clauses, similar to 'although', 'even though', or 'despite the fact that' in English. It indicates something contrary to expectations or main clause content. The word can appear at different positions in sentences but typically introduces the subordinate concessive clause.
